definition[0]: a list of the goods being carried, especially on a ship
definition[1]: a document that gives information about goods being transported. A bill of lading is also a contract to transport the goods, and shows that the transporter has received the goods
example[0]: If the buyer finds the bill of lading is not in order, he can refuse it.
example[1]: With general cargo vessels, hundreds of bills of lading may have to be issued.
